title: Toronto City Hall
summary: The Toronto City Hall, or New City Hall, is the seat of the municipal government of Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and one of the city's most distinctive landmarks. Designed by Viljo Revell and engineered by Hannskarl Bandel, the building opened in 1965. It replaced the neighbouring Old City Hall, which was occupied by the municipal government since 1899 and continues to house municipal offices and courts.[3] The new city hall is located adjacent to Nathan Phillips Square at the northwest intersection of Bay Street and Queen Street.
